intro: Oenone latifolia, commonly known as broadleaf oenone, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Oenone latifolia typically grows in wetlands and along stream banks, preferring moist, well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and wetland conservation efforts.
